Bond said: "Couldnt make it. Splitting headache."
Christmas said: "The soldiers may give you a hard time. Whatever. If we werent around, theyd have their whole nuclear arsenal lying by the roadsides, rotting in the sun."

Christmas said: "He is an impostor.  Theres no Davidov at Miratom."
Bond said: "Heres your imposter. Hes paid off the men on the plane outside.  Theyre not taking the bomb to any Russian facility, theyre flying it wherever he tells them."

Bond said: "Shame you had to spot I wasnt the real thing."
Christmas said: "So who are you?"
Bond said: "Bond --"

Christmas said: "They wont get far. Every warhead has a locator card.  A Miratom device.  Emits a high-pitched signal on Russian emergency frequencies. We can track the bomb."
Bond said: "With this?"

Bond said: "When this is over we should bury the hatchet. Celebrate. A champagne dinner?"
Christmas said: "When this is over our bodies may be blown to smithereens."
Bond said: "Alright then, brunch."

Christmas said: "The plutonium is missing.  Theyve taken the core!"
Bond said: "Then its no longer a bomb?"
Christmas said: "Its a bomb alright. Were still dead if the trigger charge goes off..."

Christmas said: "What the hell were you doing?  You nearly killed us!"
Bond said: "I did kill us. She thinks were dead. And she thinks she got away with it."
Christmas said: "What the hell are you talking about?"
Bond said: "Its part of some plan. She dresses it up like a terrorist attack.  The explosion covers up the theft of the plutonium."
Christmas said: "Whos she?"
Bond said: "Elektra King."
Christmas said: "Elektra King?  Are you insane?  This is her pipeline."
Bond said: "Makes her look even more innocent."
Christmas said: "What would she want with weapons grade plutonium?"
Bond said: "I was hoping you could tell me."

Christmas said: "What is it?"
Bond said: "She just upped the stakes. All her chips are on the table now.  And Ms life is part of the bet."

Bond said: "Nuclear."
Christmas said: "Not just nuclear. Powered by a nuclear reactor.  Hes not loading any cargo. They want the sub. The sub itself. Put weapons grade plutonium inside the subs reactor: Instant, catastrophic meltdown."
Bond said: "Made to look just like an accident."

Christmas said: "But why? Eight million people would die, the land irradiated for a hundred years. A cloud of radiation the size of Europe..."
Bond said: "Because an explosion like that would kill all the other pipelines. There would be only one way to get the oil out of the Caspian and pump it to the world..."
Christmas said: "The King pipeline."
Bond said: "Elektra would control it all."

Christmas said: "Zukovsky..."
Bond said: "If I dont get to the Boa before he gets to Maidens Tower, M is dead."

Christmas said: "Is there another way?"
Bond said: "We go down to the torpedo bay."

Bond said: "Hes sealed himself in."
Christmas said: "Hes going to insert the plutonium."

Christmas said: "Do you know what youre doing?"
Bond said: "Like riding a bike."

Christmas said: "What kind of bikes did you ride?"
Bond said: "Just wanted to put him on edge..."

Bond said: "Count to twenty.  When you get to twenty open the hatch.  It can only be opened for a few seconds or well sink."
Christmas said: "But what if..."

Bond said: "Weve got to get out."

Bond said: "I love Christmas in Turkey."

Laurie said: "Then why don't you ask him?!?"

Schmidt said: "Sit down, Miss Juspeczyk.  As I mentioned, the people in this file are all close associates of Dr. Manhattan.  They have something else in common as well.  They've all developed a fairly . . . exotic form of lymphatic cancer."
Laurie said: "What are you saying?  That Jon is radioactive?"

Schmidt said: "I'm terribly sorry."
Laurie said: "What does this mean?  What does it --"
Schmidt said: "Six to eight months.  That's with treatment.  -- Perhaps now you can see why it's so vital that we locate your . . . friends."
Laurie said: "That's it.  This is all a trick, isn't it?  Some kind of horrible joke to make me --"

Schmidt said: "All right, Miss Juspeczyk.  Pack your things."
Laurie said: "Am I free to go?"
Schmidt said: "You're free to do whatever you goddamn well please.  Let's move it."
Laurie said: "I don't know why you've been keeping me here, but you're in deep shit --"
Schmidt said: "Oh, I am, honey.  You see, Russian tanks are crossing the Afghan border this very minute.  And we are all of us, every living soul, in deep, deep shit -- because our number-one strategic weapons has finally flipped out."
Laurie said: "Jon??  You mean he's --"
Schmidt said: "That's right.  Your meal ticket's flown the coop.  That blue bastard has apparently left the planet."

Laurie said: "Adrian."
Veidt said: "Laurie!  Good to see you."

Laurie said: "Don't rub it in.  I live here."
Veidt said: "And how's life with the walking H-bomb?"
Laurie said: "He's in by the superaccelerator.  -- Let me take your coat."

Laurie said: "Adrian!  Don't leave so soon.  I --"
Veidt said: "I'll take a raincheck, Laurie."
Laurie said: "Please."

Veidt said: "He's a little farther gone every time."
Laurie said: "Stay, Adrian.  I just -- every once in a while, I need to talk to someone human.  He doesn't think like we do.  He doesn't even feel what we feel.  I mean -- he even scares the research teams."
Veidt said: "Laurie -- he's the most powerful man who's ever lived.  He's changed the world."
Laurie said: "I know.  I shouldn't be saying this.  He's happy, he's content, he's doing his work --"
Veidt said: "What about you?"
Laurie said: "I suppose I'm serving my purpose, aren't I.  I'll ring for the guards."

Veidt said: "Nasty cough.  -- Try one of mine.  Darling, you need to get out of the house.  Why don't you give Daniel a call?  I'm sure he'd be glad to hear from you."
Laurie said: "Maybe I'll do that."
Veidt said: "I'm sorry about Blake."

Moloch said: "I don't know who you are buddy, but I swear to God, you got the wrong guy."
Rorschach said: "Edgar William Jacobi, aka William Edgar Bright, a.k.a. Moloch."
Moloch said: "You're making a big --"

Rorschach said: "Terrorist.  Radical agitator.  Stool pigeon."
Moloch said: "ALL RIGHT!  ALL RIGHT!!  -- How'd you find me?"

Moloch said: "Rorschach, you're talkin' heavy duty stuff.  I got nothing to do with --"
Rorschach said: "Worked both sides of the fence.  Ask your old buddies in the CTU."
Moloch said: "CTU?  Jesus.  You don't think --"
Rorschach said: "Don't know.  Ask around.  I'll be back."

Rorschach said: "Two things I hate.  Street mimes . . . users of recreational drugs."
Moloch said: "No, no.  You got it all wrong.  I been on the case, Rorschach, I got something for you."

Rorschach said: "New information."
Veidt said: "Ever see one of these before?"
Rorschach said: "Too important for telephone.  Comedian -- Dr. Manhattan.  All linked up."
Veidt said: "What is that ungodly smell?"

Rorschach said: "Bigger than I thought.  CTU involved . . ."
Veidt said: "Yeah, I've heard all about your conspiracy theories.  Now I've got a roomful of cameras in there.  I want you out.  Now.  And whatever you're doing, knock it off.  You're making us all look bad."
Rorschach said: "Fate of the world at stake, Adrian.  Can't get too worked up over bad press."

Rorschach said: "Gila Flats -- place where Jon turned into . . ."
Veidt said: "Dr. Manhattan, right.  Now if you boys care to join me, we'll go save the world."

Rorschach said: "Veidt.  You're the one who started World War III."
Veidt said: "No.  I just hastened the inevitable.  He's been ready to blow for years.  I knew all it would take was a little push.  So I, uh . . . gave his friends and associates cancer."

Rorschach said: "Call off the cat and I'll kill you, Veidt."
Veidt said: "Before you do that, you might want to look at what I've been looking at."

Xander said: "Who the hell are you?"
Gibbons said: "The name's Gibbons. You were saying?"
Xander said: "What is this place?"
Gibbons said: "Looks like a diner."
Xander said: "Diner, huh? Let me tell you what the problem is. I wake up drugged to find what? You've got a "salesman" over here reading a three week old newspaper. He's pulling a 211 with a "trucker", who happens to be packing a cop issue H&K 9mm. I get tipped that something is going down when she passes me a note. How's that for twisted logic? How did she know there was trouble unless they pulled the guns before I "walked" in? And if that's true, why'd they stop and wait until I woke up to gaffle the money? Then I notice how beefy they both are. Hell, even the waitress is cut. All three of them look like they went through the same training program. Ergo they ain't strangers and this isn't what it seems. That's how I knew yo-yo wouldn't get a round off even if I gave him all day. Why?"

Gibbons said: "Most guys we ran through this either took off or helped them rob the place. I expected you to do the same."
Xander said: "That shows me already that you don't have a clue. What's it to you, anyway?"
Gibbons said: "Whether you thought this was for real or not, you jumped in and helped the waitress on instinct. That tells me something about your character."
Xander said: "Good for you. Now why don't you stop wasting my time and tell me what you want. You didn't go through all this for my benefit."
Gibbons said: "It's your lucky day. You just might get the chance to pay back our wonderful country for all the freedom you enjoy."
Xander said: "A Fed, I shoulda known. Who else would have this kind of budget? Now you're gonna hit me with the sales pitch."
Gibbons said: "Alright, Cage, you've got me. This is one of those moments. "Many are called, few are chosen", that kind of thing. Your government needs you. Are you up for the challenge?"
Xander said: "..If you're trolling around for narcs, man, have you got the wrong guy."
Gibbons said: "Why is that?"
Xander said: "Look at me, dude, do I look like a fan of law enforcement? Forget the tests, you shoulda just asked me. I woulda saved you a lot of trouble."
Gibbons said: "Oh I don't know, I think the tests work pretty well. Sometimes they give me answers you wouldn't admit to in a million years."
Xander said: "Are we done now? You've got nothing on me. So if you ain't booking me, I'm walking."
Gibbons said: "You've got this wrong. You're not under arrest, you've been abducted. And until I say different, you belong to me."
Xander said: "Is that a fact?"
Gibbons said: "Sure as gravity. I've had a feeling about you from the start, Cage. It's nausea."
Xander said: "You know what I hate? Any scumbag with a clean shirt and a bad haircut can get one of those tin stars and suddenly they think they're God."
Gibbons said: "You know what I hate? It's always the assholes that pass the tests."

Gibbons said: "Congratulations, you've just graduated at the head of your class."
Xander said: "You're a cold piece of work. You almost got three people killed out there."
Gibbons said: "Good thing you were there to save the day. Come walk with me."

Gibbons said: "You've really got me confused, Cage. On the one hand you showed leadership, courage under fire, a willingness to protect men you hardly knew... and on the other you have an arrest record that pegs you as near sociopathic. Help me out here. I'm not following your evolution."
Xander said: "You want the cheap backstory? The runaway mom, the suicide dad and the foster homes? Gimme a break. You're not interested in my past, you're interested in my future as some kind of spy."
Gibbons said: "You're perceptive too. I forgot to add that to the list of surprises. I'm with the National Security Agency. And unlikely as it may sound, I need your help."
Xander said: "I'm not interested. I've already got a job."
Gibbons said: "You're an adrenaline junkie with one foot in the penitentiary. You risk your ass building a daredevil myth that means nothing and you're not getting any younger."
Xander said: "I plan on getting a lot older. And playing spy games sounds like a quick way to get yourself dead."
Gibbons said: "That's too bad. I thought a guy like you would appreciate the challenge."

Xander said: "Now I'm the one who's nauseous. So what's the deal? What do you need me for?"
Gibbons said: "There's some folks I want to keep tabs on. Dirty, tattooed, uncivilized. Your kind of people."
Xander said: "What do I get out of it?"
Gibbons said: "If you find out what I want to know, and if I'm able to successfully use that information, you get to go back to your degenerate little life. If not, you take a bath."
Xander said: "You're one sick bastard. A sadist with a badge looking to rope me in to a suicide mission. I think no matter which way I go I'm likely to wind up face down on a sheet of plastic. So here's my answer: kiss my ass, Hop-along."

Xander said: "Not bad for a gimp."
Gibbons said: "What's with that "X" on the back of your head? Does that mean you're "extreme"? I've got some news for you, Mr. X, you're a three time loser. So maybe you should tattoo another couple of X's on your head."

Xander said: "How about a pedicure as long as you're down there. What's this? Lo-Jack?"
Gibbons said: "Wherever you go on the planet, I'll find you. There's no quitting. If you try to take it off, a ring of needles will inject enough curare into your bloodstream to kill you before you hit the ground. Is all that clear?"
Xander said: "Yeah, I spy or I die."

Gibbons said: "I expect you to call in regularly with progress reports."
Xander said: "Fine, but I'm not gonna be no Bulldog Omega 5."

Xander said: "Up yours."
Gibbons said: "Crude and defiant as always, Triple X. It fits so well because you're obscene."

Xander said: "Is that all?"
Gibbons said: "Just remember, I'll be watching."

Xander said: "I guess you got my E-mail. I set up a purchase. Ten cars."
Gibbons said: "If you're trying to push my buttons, you're on the right track. Don't make me question my own judgment, X."
Xander said: "Buddy, you sent me here to get close to their organization, that costs money."
Gibbons said: "One point two million dollars? I did not authorize you to spend one point two million dollars!"
Xander said: "I'm already on a first name basis with these dudes, I got a deal set up, you want me to hammer it or not?"
Gibbons said: "We're not after car thieves here."
Xander said: "What the hell am I after? You're telling me dick."
Gibbons said: "That information is classified. You're there to gather information on their operations, period."
Xander said: "Call me crazy, but I thought hooking up a million dollar deal was a great way to get on their good side. What else? You gonna hassle me about the weapons and spy stuff too?"
Gibbons said: "My friend, if you're planning on crossing me..."
Xander said: "I know, poison needles in my shins. You've got 36 hours. Peace, out."

Gibbons said: "You did say "Ahab"? You're sure about that?"
Xander said: "Yeah, I sent you pictures. Here's what I'm thinking. If they take out the cameras and sensors, they could probably put a bomb in this thing. You drop it in the water in the Red Sea and three weeks later it's swimming up the Potomac."
Gibbons said: "This is good work, X, damn fine work. You need to press on at all costs, find out what they have planned with this "Ahab"."
Xander said: "Hey, one miracle at a time. They're on to me now, remember?"
Gibbons said: "I'm gonna be en route with a team shortly to relieve you. Just keep the pressure on until the cavalry arrives. And X? You done yourself proud helping those people today."

Xander said: "Thanks."
Gibbons said: "You're a grungy little phoenix, you know that? Keep up the good work."
Xander said: "You ain't seen nothing yet."

Xander said: "Snow covered fortress. Army of bad guys. The usual."
Gibbons said: "I'm on the way with a team to relieve you. What's the latest?"
Xander said: "They retrofitted Ahab with some kind of rocket launcher. They were loading canisters of liquid into it, light colored and dark colored in the same tube but separate. Something tells me this it that "classified" stuff you didn't want me to know about. Does the song "Silent Night" mean anything to you?"
Gibbons said: "Yes it does."
Xander said: "Come on, Gibbons, you can do better then that."
Gibbons said: "Silent Night is the name of a top secret binary nerve agent. The glass canister is shot into the air and detonated. The black and white chemicals mix, forming a toxic cloud. When it settles down to Earth, it'll kill everything in the vicinity."
Xander said: "Jesus Christ, Gibbons, this is something we came up with?"
Gibbons said: "Yeah, that's right. So now that you know, you understand why it's important that we get it back."
Xander said: "Kinda funny, though, isn't it? We're not supposed to be making weapons like that anyway. Guess we shoulda played by the rules."
Gibbons said: "Somebody else makes those decisions, not guys like you and me. You've done your job, X, head back to Prague. I'll be landing in 90 minutes. This is my operation now."
Xander said: "We don't have that kinda time, boss, I don't think Prague's gonna be around much longer. I've gotta go now. I've got a lot of bad guys to kill."

Gibbons said: "Thought you bought the farm down there, X. Glad as hell to see you."
Xander said: "I'm pretty happy to see me too. So are you done with me yet?"
Gibbons said: "You've kept up your end of the bargain, I'll do the same. But you really should consider staying on, you make a decent agent."
Xander said: "But I hate cops, remember? Except for her."
Gibbons said: "Cut the crap, X, I saw you down there. You're a hero. Don't be afraid to join the good guys."
Xander said: "Who says you're the good guys?"

Gibbons said: "You know what they say, the only way to change the system is from the inside."
Xander said: "Oh yeah? Why don't we start by taking this thing off my ankle? The poison needles?"
Gibbons said: "On come on, X. Did you really think we were that barbaric?"
Xander said: "No needles, huh? What about the acid bath?"
Gibbons said: "All for show. Just a psychological mind game to get you to do the right thing."
Xander said: "You're a jerk-off, you know that?"

Sam Tannick said: "What do you have?"
Gibbons said: "Not a whole helluva lot. His final transmission was mangled. About something or someone called "Ahab". Whatever it is, it cost him his life."
Sam Tannick said: "He was the best there was. That makes three agents lost."
Gibbons said: "They're ruthless and they have a lot of firepower. It's only a matter of time before they figure out how to deploy Silent Night. Then we're gonna have a catastrophe on our hands."
Sam Tannick said: "Silent Night in the hands of a bunch of impertinent cowboys"
Gibbons said: "We're gonna have to step in, Sam. Those CIA boys couldn't find a clown in a field of cactus. Let me take care of it."
Sam Tannick said: "How will you fix it?"
Gibbons said: "I'll go in with a team. But first I'm going to need some intel. I'll have to put someone inside, someone new, someone they won't see coming. One of their own."
Sam Tannick said: "So you'll dredge the bottom again. You've done that before. The results were... uneven."
Gibbons said: "You wanna find out about rats, ask a rat. I've had my people put together a talent pool. I downloaded it to your desktop."

Gibbons said: "The usual prospects. Convicts, contract killers, murde..."
Sam Tannick said: "The scum of the Earth."
Gibbons said: "But programmable. And expendable."
Sam Tannick said: "I've seen enough. Turn it off."

Sam Tannick said: "They're degenerates. There's not a man in there that would give a damn if the Chinese took over."
Gibbons said: "That's exactly why we need them."

Sam Tannick said: "Ridiculous. Cut him off. I'm sorry Gibbons, you pulled up a shark this time."
Gibbons said: "I think we should send him whatever he wants."
Sam Tannick said: "You what? A wire transfer of this size?"
Gibbons said: "If it means getting Silent Night back, absolutely."
Sam Tannick said: "You're talking about a very expensive risk here."
Gibbons said: "He's gotten closer in 24 hours than all of the other operatives combined. He got us an account number to boot. Now even if he's just dumb and lucky, I say we back his play.  I put him out there, Sam. If he doesn't come up with the money, they'll kill him. I can't let that happen."
Sam Tannick said: "Why not? You were going to throw him in a tub full of acid, weren't you?"

Sam Tannick said: "Alright, do what you want. But keep the screws on him. He's a wild card. That could be either good or bad."
Gibbons said: "So the odds are up to fifty-fifty? I can deal with that."

Jefe said: "Whatchu doing here?"
Xander said: "Oh, I don't know. It was an accident."
Jefe said: "That's some accident, hombre. You accidentally fall out of a plane in the middle of the night and land up in my back yard."

Jefe said: "We seen this kind of parachutes before, you know. U.S. Army. You got some friends here, jump out with you guys?"
Xander said: "We're anti-social. We don't have any friends."

Xander said: "We're on to the game, ese. You got the fake blood splattered all over the walls, you got your torture tools... It's all very cute. But come on, let's quit while you're ahead. I'm only trying to save you a beatin'."
Jefe said: "You saving me? You talking pretty tough for a guy got himself chained to the ceiling."
Xander said: "Alright. You wanna eat through a tube, be my guest."
Jefe said: "Now you're gonna make me enjoy this, funny guy. Now I'm gonna take the whole foot off. Whatchu think of that?"

Kid said: "What game is that?"
Xander said: "Slick graphics, huh? See these dudes? They're called "Anarchy 99", they're the bad guy bosses."
Kid said: "Do they have any special powers? The bosses always have special powers."
Xander said: "You wanna check it out? Come here."

Xander said: "Next we got a Siberian redneck, Viktor. Into snowmobiles and snowboarding. So naturally, he covers prostitution and the drug trade."
Kid said: "Naturally."

Kid said: "This guy's kinda dorky lookin'."
Xander said: "Kirill, the sniper. Looks like a bookworm, but he had 72 confirmed kills in Chechnya, they called him the "Finger of God". Assassination and weapons."

Xander said: "Yorgi masterminded the take-over of three Red Mafiya clans. Cops called it "blood week". He combined all of their global enterprises into one huge crime syndicate: Anarchy 99."
Kid said: ""Anarchy" 99"?"
Xander said: "What are you gonna do? They're Euro- trash."
Kid said: "What weapons do you have?"

Xander said: "Just about anything I want, it looks like. This is gonna be tough, though. There's no way to save this game. I gotta get it right the first time through."
Kid said: "What do you get if you finish?"
Xander said: "Nothing, really. My guy is just doing it to stay alive."
Kid said: "Oh. I bet by the end he gets something out of it."
Xander said: "Like what?"
Kid said: "He gets to be the hero."

Petra said: "Ten is hardly worth the effort. We're talking a lousy million five U.S."
Xander said: "I have Japanese buyers who are looking to move a fleet, if you have the quality of merchandise they're after. And it's a mil two, max."

Petra said: "Do you know what a wire transfer is?"
Xander said: "Is she for real? Honey, maybe you should quiet down and let the grownups have a conversation."
Petra said: "My goodness, a word with four syllables. I should get some ice before your brain gets too hot."
Xander said: "Sure. Just chisel some off your heart."
Petra said: "So cute. He shows up for a battle of wits with a mental butter knife."

Xander said: "If you got a problem with me, why are we dancing?"
Petra said: "Yorgi asked me to."
Xander said: "You do everything Yorgi says?"
Petra said: "Go to hell."
Xander said: "It's gonna be like that, huh? You got all bent out of shape as soon as he started dancing with someone else. Why's that?"
Petra said: "Mind your business."
Xander said: "Did you guys used to date? That's it, right? He broke your heart and you're still soft on him. That's funny, it don't seem to fit with a tough broad like you."

Xander said: "Where are you going?"
Petra said: "Why are you still hanging around? Your business is finished, you should go home."
Xander said: "I was invited. What's your story?"
Petra said: "I don't know who you are or where you come from, but I don't like you. You ask too many questions."

Xander said: "Come on, don't front like that. You'll put a guy right off you."
Petra said: "Don't even bother, X man, I'm not your type."
Xander said: "That right? Why's that?"

Petra said: "Who are you?"
Xander said: "We hung out last night, remember?"
Petra said: "I also remember you drove your car here. Who are you really? Make no mistake, I will shoot you and not feel bad about it. Who are you working for?"
Xander said: "Hey, take it easy. I'm just a dude trying to make a buck."

Petra said: "Bullshit. I see you look at everything, study everything, ask questions. I know exactly what you're doing. Empty your pockets."
Xander said: "You've got to relax, baby, you're paranoid."

Xander said: "Hey, you're good."
Petra said: "Maybe we should start again, yes? I know so little about you, except that you're not what you say you are."
Xander said: "That makes two of us then, sweetheart, because I ain't buying your bullshit either. You're not like them, I can see it in your eyes. So you tell me, who's bullshitting who?"

Petra said: "I don't know what you're talking about."
Xander said: "The eyes don't lie. All this has gotten to you, hasn't it, Petra? You came in as Yorgi's girlfriend and you stayed because it was fun. Now you don't like it so much, but you're in so deep you can't get out anymore. Tell me if I'm wrong, Petra."
Petra said: "Go to hell!"
Xander said: "Look at you. You're helping run things now. You're a gangster. I bet that snuck up on you. You woke up one day and you were a criminal."

Petra said: "What are you?"
Xander said: "I'm an information gatherer. You wanna go somewhere and talk about it?"

Petra said: "That's how you eat? It's like a gerbil."
Xander said: "I'm from L.A."
Petra said: "So why don't you tell me something about who you gather information for. They obviously have very deep pockets. Are you from a rival clan?"
Xander said: "Let's just say I'm freelancing and leave it at that."
Petra said: "Whoever sent you knew what they were doing. You and Yorgi are practically twins. Two nihilistic fashion victims who make a lot of noise but don't say much."
Xander said: "Don't judge a comic book by it's cover."
Petra said: "You agree with a lot of what he says, don't you."
Xander said: "I know where he's coming from. The only thing I really don't get is why he dumped you. Up until I found that out, I thought his judgment was pretty sound."
Petra said: "Don't even start. I'll be honest, I don't trust you. Bur lets pretend for a minute that what you say is true, that I want to leave. What can you do about it?"
Xander said: "The people I know want facts, the kinds of things an insider would know. They're interested in putting Anarchy 99 out of business."
Petra said: "All I have to do is risk my life providing you with these facts."
Xander said: "We could work together. Then maybe we could both get the hell out of here. There's a beach in Bora Bora with my name on it."
Petra said: "A beach named X? That I'd like to see."
Xander said: "So there you have it. I guess you just have to ask yourself, how bad to you want out?"

Petra said: "They tell me you're an American agent."
Xander said: "What are you talking about?"
Petra said: "There's no more time for games. They made you. There's a sniper out front waiting to put a bullet in your eye. Tell me if it's true."
Xander said: "It's a long story, but yeah, more or less."
Petra said: "Jesus Christ. You're going to have to go out the back. The data that you copied with your toy. Tomorrow, at six o'clock. Look it up. We're taking a trip. Be there at six and you'll have plenty to tell your people."
Xander said: "If I go out the back, he'll know you've warned me."
Petra said: "That's alright, I'll figure something out."
Xander said: "Not an option. Just get up slowly like everything's cool. Petra, trust me. You just hung yourself out to dry for me, I'm not gonna let you down."

Petra said: "I can't let this happen. I want you to go out the back. I'll make up some excuse."
Xander said: "They'll kill you, you know they will. Besides, there is no back door. Keep smiling. Ready? Now."

Xander said: "So what's the plan with this Ahab? Are they selling it or what?"
Petra said: "No, something worse. He says it's a surprise, but I know him. This is his masterpiece."
Xander said: "We've got to find out what it is. Can you handle that?"
Petra said: "There's something I didn't have time to tell you before."
Xander said: "What's that?"
Petra said: "I'm a agent as well. KGB. I've been undercover for over a year."
Xander said: "You're what? What the hell have you been doing?"
Petra said: "I don't know. Eight months ago I stop hearing from my people. No explanation, just silence. So I stay and I wait like I was told. Soon I'm in so far, they'd kill me if I left. Now every day I get farther and farther away from what I was. I'm like you said, a criminal."
Xander said: "I'm busted up for you, but Jesus, what the hell are you doing? Those people almost drowned on that boat and you didn't lift a finger."

Petra said: "No, I guess I've been no help at all to you."
Xander said: "Get your head back in the game. There are lives at stake here."
Petra said: "Of course. I'll do what I can. I have to go, before they notice."
Xander said: "When can I see you again?"
Petra said: "You can't, it's too risky. I'm not much help anyway, remember?"

Petra said: "Are you alright?"
Xander said: "What the hell are you doing? You could've killed me!"
Petra said: "I heard you talking. I could tell where you were in the room."
Xander said: "I don't know what's going on anymore. I thought I was square with that dude. Now everybody's switching sides like it's the WWF."

Xander said: "What are you doing with the Ivans?"
Petra said: "I know which cops are good and which are bad. Come with me. Come on, right now."

Xander said: "Where are we going?"
Petra said: "We're getting out of this place. We've done enough."
Xander said: "Wait a minute, whoa. We can't go now. What's Yorgi got planned with that nerve agent?"
Petra said: "It doesn't matter anymore, forget it."
Xander said: "Of course it matters. Hey, hold on!"
Petra said: "What do we owe our governments? Yours kidnapped you, mine abandoned me."
Xander said: "Petra, this ain't about the people that sent us here, you know that."
Petra said: "No, now it's about us. Let's do something for us before we both get killed. Don't you want to get to Bora Bora, Xander?"
Xander said: "We can't leave now. We have to do something."
Petra said: "Why? You're the one who believes in nothing. Screw the world, or whatever you said."

Petra said: "They left. To a fortress in the mountains."
Xander said: "We'll have to go after them."
